content:
This chunk explains how to enable transparency for images in Panda3D using either Python or C++, ensuring that transparent parts of an image are rendered correctly instead of appearing black. The code demonstrates setting up alpha transparency with `TransparencyAttrib` and provides both Python and C++ implementations, making it useful for developers working with image rendering in different programming environments.

python

from panda3d.core import TransparencyAttrib

image = OnscreenImage(image='myImage.png', pos=(0, 0, 0))
image.setTransparency(TransparencyAttrib.MAlpha)

cpp

card.set_transparency(TransparencyAttrib::M_alpha);

See the section on transparency-and-blending for some caveats about rendering objects with transparency.
